column4: Can anyone recommend a good, light, functional desktop I could install?
I use that on my old P133 with 96MiB of ram
What are the benefits of XFCE with respect to things like enlightenment?
What I like is it uses GTK2 for rendering
on my old machine I simply only installed GTK2 apps
that cut down on the libs I needed to load in my tiny amount of ram
for example, I used audacious as my music player
worked pretty well, with X running, and relatively little swap used, I used only about 35MiB with XFCE4 running
he just needs to change the driver line
anyway, it worked well for me
I think there's even an XFCE4 ubuntu. I don't know if they stuck to a single gui toolkit
personally, I went gentoo, with -Os set - my theory was I cared more about the size of libraries in memory than saving on cycles :)
Life is too short to run gentoo.
heh. have 5 gentoo machines personally :) but hey, to each his own
I must say I'm spending far too much time poking at obscure issues with my mom's ubuntu system too. like this latest ubuntu breaking wireless with recent kernel rename.
seems all distros are prone to stupid updates
